page.title: 19ROYAL VISIT PART 2
page.content: practice for the big moment. People in the crowd who had radio's kept the crowd informed of the journey from Lincoln. Suddenly the cars swept into view. The crowds cheered and the flags waved. Then the cars stopped in front of the building and the Princess got out. She was wearing a grey and white vertically striped jacket with a grey skirt. Her hat was wide brimmed, white with a grey band around the brim. Inside the building she met the residents and spent about an hour talking to the staff and dignitaries that were assembled. She was very popular with all of the people and won many more fans by her relaxed friendliness. After signing the visitors book and a photograph sha came outside and went on a short walk-about. It was a most enjoyable occasion.
